Posts.Content: sadsel wrote: Hi guys, need input.  Husband had mastectomy 5 weeks ago. Just pulled drain 1-1/2 weeks ago.  Was still draining first week drain was pulled and it was dressed to absorb the fluid.  The drain incision finally sealed off and is no longer draining.  2 days after that happened, his left breast area became very red and warm with fluid building up again. Called doc and put him on antibiotics.  He now has big blood blister which popped on its own but skin is still weeping. Put dressing on so no germs could get to it.  He has appt with doc today.  Anybody have ANY kind of experience with this?  I'm panicking that it could be major infection and may need more surgery.  Let me know please!  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2009 05:04PM sadsel wrote: Hi everyone, My husband has been having the symptoms of Paget's of the nipple, scaling, bloody discharge, extreme itching and some burning.  GP sent DH to derm dr and he did a punch biopsy to figure out what was going on.  He did say that it could be Paget's.  His mammogram and US were negative, they were done in Feb, but the nipple just kept getting worse. We are waiting on results.  I can't thank everyone enough for all the information on this board.  I feel if he does have it, at least we have an idea of what to expect. I was freaked out at first, but have now come to terms that it may be bad news but he will do fine.  If anyone's husband has gone through this, please post as I would like to know how things went for them.  Thanks again for all the info, it is definitely a Godsend, especially to a newbie! Hugs to all of you! Sadie
